summary: This is an internal DOJ communication from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) to the Offices of the Attorney General and Deputy Attorney General. It outlines the plan to indict two correctional officers at the Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC) for making false statements and conspiring to obstruct the MCC's functions related to the night of Jeffrey Epstein's suicide. The indictment date is shifted from November 14 to November 19, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document states that the charges against the correctional officers stem from their conduct on the night he committed suicide while in custody at the Manhattan Correctional Center.

events.title: Planned Indictment and Arrests of MCC Officers
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York plans to seek an indictment and the FBI-NY plans to conduct arrests of two correctional officers from the Manhattan Correctional Center.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide while in custody at the Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC). The conduct of two correctional officers on that night is the subject of the planned indictment.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York planned to indict two correctional officers from the Manhattan Correctional Center (MCC) for crimes related to the night of Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.
The charges against the officers included making false statements and conspiring to make false statements and obstruct the lawful function of the MCC.

The operational timeline was adjusted, with the indictment sought on November 19, 2019, instead of the initially indicated date of November 14, 2019, with arrests to be conducted by the FBI-NY on the same day.
The document is a formal synopsis sent to the highest levels of the U.S. Department of Justice (the Offices of the Attorney General and Deputy Attorney General).
The document references an 'Urgent Report 2019-11-47430' as the source of the detailed description of the planned charges.
